resources.string:
Indian cuisine consists of a variety of regional and traditional cuisines local to the Indian subcontinent.
 Due to the diversity in soil, climate, culture, ethnic groups and professions, these cuisines are very diverse and use locally available spices, herbs, vegetables and fruits.

Indian cuisine is characterized by the variety of its dishes and the abundance of spices in it, so it has bright and distinctive aromas from other foods, so most chefs prefer this area, it is easy to practice, as Indians use curry paper, which has a spicy taste, and rice, and they were known for curry rice, curry chicken, and tandoori chicken.

Indian food is also heavily influenced by religion, in particular Hinduism and Islam, cultural choices and traditions
It is characterized by the variety of its dishes and the abundance of spices in it, so it has bright and distinctive smells from other foods
Indians use curry leaves, which have a spicy taste, and rice..

Since the very beginning of history, India has been known as The land of spices .
The Chinese, Arabs and Europeans came to the coasts of India in search of spices that grow here, they have been used since ancient history, mentioned in ancient Indian texts known as Vedas, in ancient papyri and in the Old Testament.
Historical records indicate that in 80 BC, when the city of Alexandria became the busiest trading center on earth, its markets were selling Indian spices on their way to the markets of the Greek and Roman empires.
The Department of Indian antiquities has announced the discovery of 100 thousand Roman coins in the delta of the Cauvery river, in southern India on the ancient historical Spice Route.
There are more than 80 types of spices grown around the world, of which 50 are in India alone.
